sentences.english: Silent lamb The freshly-made lambs are sold at the commercial area with many tourists.
sentences.chinese: 《沉默的羔羊》在遊人衆多的商業點，羔羊現殺現賣。

sentences.english: Silent lamb The freshly-made lambs are sold at the commercial area with many tourists.
sentences.chinese: 《沉默的羔羊》在遊人衆多的商業點，羔羊現殺現賣。

sentences.english: He must have heard the bleating of the sacrificial Iambs waiting to be killed.
sentences.chinese: 他一定聽到等待被宰的羔羊的叫聲。

sentences.english: The lost lamb can escape the clutches of the wolf?
sentences.chinese: 這頭迷途的羔羊能逃離狼的魔爪嗎？

sentences.english: In general a dream about a lamb foretells many good things.
sentences.chinese: 在一般的夢想，約羔羊，預示了許多很好的事情。

sentences.english: The gloves are made of lambswool which means that they won’t scratch your display.
sentences.chinese: 此手套用羔羊毛製作，所以不會劃傷顯示屏。

sentences.english: I just get my parole, and do not want to be your scapegoat somehow.
sentences.chinese: 我纔剛剛假釋耶，不想莫名其妙的變成你的代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: A patsy was blamed for killing President Kennedy.
sentences.chinese: 一個代罪羔羊被指責行刺甘乃迪總統。
羔羊遇上獅子自當逃走。

sentences.english: The whole Christian gospel of salvation was based upon a belief in a sinless sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 基督教福音是建立在一個無罪的羔羊的身上。

sentences.english: These are they which follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth.
sentences.chinese: 羔羊無論往那裏去，他們都跟隨他。

sentences.english: Londoncannot claim credit for having produced all of the whipping-boys of the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 不能歸罪倫敦給金融危機帶來這麼多帶罪羔羊。

sentences.english: The results were as follows:1 Feed restriction during late pregnancy did have effect on the lamb birth weight of sunit ewes.
sentences.chinese: 蘇尼特羊妊娠後期限制飼養對羔羊初生重是有影響的。

sentences.english: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, and like rams with kids.
sentences.chinese: 我必使他們下到屠場，無異羔羊綿羊和山羊。

sentences.english: And Abel gave an offering of the young lambs of his flock and of their fat.
sentences.chinese: 亞伯也將他羊羣中頭生的羔羊的脂油獻上。

definition: (fig.) attractive and easy mark/source of steady profit/moneymaker/cash cow
to slaughter/(fig.) to ride roughshod over/to take advantage of (others)
